poem:
**The Last Balloon**

bright aisles deflated—  
day-old confetti  
rustles in forlorn corners  
  
the helium dreams  
float away, released—  
a last, silent cheer  
  
party hats discarded  
stirring like echoes  
of whispered celebrations  
  
in the hollowed halls  
of an empty revelry—  
the final curtain drawn.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Party City shutters after nearly 40 years, firing workers without severance pay The party is over at Party City, once the largest supplier of balloons and other fun-time supplies in the US, as the company announced Friday it was closing down all of its stores, ending nearly 40 years in business. Barry Litwin, the Party City CEO, told employees that the chain was “winding down” operations immediately and that today would be their last day". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
